authors.name: Naeem Nadaf
authors.affiliation: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"r5e9","text":"This protocol details the isolation of nuclei from frozen tissue for subsequent single-nuclei sequencing using a droplet-based platform, such as 10X Genomics. The procedure emphasizes maintaining the integrity of nuclei and minimizing RNA degradation, using a series of specialized buffers and careful handling techniques.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"6hg7","text":"This protocol provides a meticulous approach to extracting and processing nuclei from frozen tissues, ensuring high-quality samples suitable for droplet-based single-nuclei sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7f92b","text":"Pre-Cooling:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdrc8","text":"Ensure all buffers are cooled to   before use","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fmtoq","text":"Pre-cool centrifuge, tubes, well plates, 26-gauge needle, 40 µm cell strainer, and syringe at   for at least 20 minutes. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":94,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5488376A5F1A11EFB1AE0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djihi","text":"Tissue Dissociation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46qn7","text":"Transfer the frozen tissue sample to the prepared 6-well plate using 150 µL of ExB buffer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f28n","text":"Triturate by pipetting the 1 mL volume slowly up and down using a 1 mL Rainin pipette tip (#30389212) without creating froth or bubbles. Perform 25-30 strokes, pause for 2 minutes, and repeat 4-5 times. Monitor progress; add a fifth pass only if dissociation appears incomplete.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afdl9","text":"Pass the entire volume through a 26-gauge needle twice into the same well.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24unq","text":"Sample Processing: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56kdg","text":"Transfer the extracted sample (~1 mL) into a 50 mL Falcon tube. Add 30 mL of wash buffer to dissociate the nuclei, then split the volume between two pre-coated Falcon tubes (15+ mL each)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dvdp","text":"Centrifuge at 600xg for 10 minutes at 4°C.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sul4","text":"Supernatant Removal: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhmi0","text":"Aspirate the supernatant, leaving 500 µL in each tube. Pool the two samples to obtain 1 mL of nuclei suspension.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b008h","text":"Filter the sample through a pre-cooled 40 µm cell strainer using gravity only (no pressure) into a new, clean, pre-cooled Falcon tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv0n4","text":"Staining: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rm83","text":"Transfer and measure the volume of the filtrate into a pre-cooled 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mncv","text":"Stain the nuclei by adding DAPI (Thermo, #62248) at a 1:1000 dilution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8gcp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"t89g","text":"FACS Preparation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nogh","text":"Coat a 0.2 mL PCR tube with 5% BSA. Use a chilled 96-well FACS plate (Sony M800 FACSorter) to capture nuclei in the PCR tube. Pre-fill the PCR tube with 20 µL of CDB to cushion the FACS stream/nuclei.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dca","text":"FACS Sorting:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs57u","text":"Perform FACS enrichment for singlets using the singlet DAPI peak. Sort at speed 6 with a forward scatter gain of 1% on the DAPI gate. Use the \"purity\" mode. Avoid spinning down after FACS unless using the gentle spin protocol.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aom07","text":"Extraction Buffer (ExB):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aft55","text":"  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"tt8u","text":"  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8j48c","text":"  (final concentration 1%)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"edr8q","text":"  (final concentration 0.01%)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b9vbb","text":"RNase inhibitor: 1 tube (Lucigen, 10,000 units)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"18CBE4CC5B1711EFB7510A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"DB (Dissociation Buffer)","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"18CBE5505B1711EFB7510A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"Kollidon VA64","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"18CBE5C75B1711EFB7510A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"TX-100 ","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"18CBE62C5B1711EFB7510A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"10% BSA      ","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"524v","text":"Wash Buffer (WB): Prepare 30 mL per sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k70j","text":"  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9v3ve","text":"  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ro2o","text":"  of RNase inhibitor (Lucigen, 10,000 units)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"2329AD1E5B1711EF937D0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"DB (Dissociation Buffer)","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"2329AD9C5B1711EF937D0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"10%BSA ","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"2329AE045B1711EF937D0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Nuclei Extraction protocol, optimized for small tissue pieces
Nuclei Extraction protocol, optimized for small tissue pieces
Nuclei FACS enrichment for singlets on singlet DAPI peak
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b2996","text":"Collection of FACS-Sorted Samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lpkc","text":"To ensure the integrity and minimal collection volume of FACS-sorted nuclei, samples are collected in PCR tubes positioned within a chilled (-20°C) 96-well cold block. This setup is essential to maintain nuclei quality and prevent degradation. A suitable cold block can be found here: Eppendorf PCR Coolers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45b00","text":"1. Volume Measurement:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l8ho","text":"Use a pipette to accurately determine the volume of the collected nuclei suspension in each PCR tube post-FACS.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1stla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f858s","text":"2. Dilution Preparation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m8pb","text":"Prepare a 1:10 dilution by combining 18 µL of chilled Dissociation Buffer (DB) with 2 µL of the nuclei suspension in a PCR tube. Mix thoroughly.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e10ia","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b33rg","text":"3. Counting Nuclei:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"681lf","text":"Load the diluted sample onto a Fuchs-Rosenthal hemocytometer (16 chambers).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uclb","text":"Visualize using a fluorescent microscope, capturing images under both brightfield and DAPI excitation to ensure debris removal and accurate nuclei identification.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgclh","text":"Count the nuclei across all 16 large squares for precise concentration determination.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97o96","text":"Calculate the average nuclei count per square, multiply by 10 (to account for the 1:10 dilution), and then multiply by 5 (the hemocytometer factor) to determine the final nuclei concentration in nuclei/µL.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgnjj","text":"For the 10X Genomics v3 workflow, the input volume is 46.6 µL. To maximize data output, the optimal nuclei concentration should be 364 nuclei/µL, translating to an input of approximately 17,000 nuclei per 46.6 µL next gem kit.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at9kr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl7ng","text":"This protocol provides a meticulous approach to extracting and processing nuclei from frozen tissues, ensuring high-quality samples suitable for droplet-based single-nuclei sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: FACS Nuclei Isolation
